top_procedures.description: Established patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 15 minutes
Testing for presence of drug
Established patient office or other outpatient, visit typically 25 minutes

Drug test(s), definitive, utilizing (1) drug identification methods able to identify individual drugs and distinguish between structural isomers (but not necessarily stereoisomers), including, but not limited to gc/ms (any type, single or tandem) and lc/ms

Drug test(s), definitive, utilizing (1) drug identification methods able to identify individual drugs and distinguish between structural isomers (but not necessarily stereoisomers), including, but not limited to gc/ms (any type, single or tandem) and lc/ms

Drug tests(s), presumptive, any number of drug classes; any number of devices or procedures by instrumented chemistry analyzers utilizing immunoassay, enzyme assay, TOF, MALDI, LDTD, DESI, DART, GHPC, GC mass spectrometry), includes sample validation when
Injections of anesthetic and/or steroid drug into lower or sacral spine nerve root using imaging guidance
Testing of autonomic (sympathetic) nervous system function, at least 5 minutes of tilt
Injection of substance into spinal canal of lower back or sacrum using imaging guidance
Injection procedure into sacroiliac joint for anesthetic or steroid
New patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 30 minutes

Drug test(s), definitive, utilizing (1) drug identification methods able to identify individual drugs and distinguish between structural isomers (but not necessarily stereoisomers), including, but not limited to gc/ms (any type, single or tandem) and lc/ms
Ultrasound study of arteries of both arms and legs
Destruction of lower or sacral spinal facet joint nerves using imaging guidance
Testing of autonomic (sympathetic) nervous system function
Drug screen, other than chromatographic; any number of drug classes, by clia waived test or moderate complexity test, per patient encounter
Injections of substances into lower or sacral spine
Moderate sedation services by physician also performing a procedure, patient 5 years of age or older, first 30 minutes
Injection of substance into spinal canal of upper or middle back using imaging guidance
Fluoroscopic guidance for insertion of needle
